column11: Review Text

It’s a mini Paradise. you must visit if you are going to Nuwaraelaiya. It’s a different experience than visiting Haggala garden or worlds end. To reach the destination, use google map. After a few Km passing Haggala gardens you need to turn right & sign board with direction are there. Do not start climbing from the first entry as its little difficult. Just pass the main entrée and drive another few hundred meters.  Ask for the path that going along with small canal. I went with my two kids 5 & 8 years & they enjoy wel. We went on a sunny day I am not sure how it will be on rainy day. You need to pay 20 as entry ticket. It will take 40 to 60 mins to reach to the waterfall. Take water with you, but there are many small shops who sale tea & local short eats. You are not allowed to bath in the water fall & If you badly need a bath get it from somewhere far from water fall as water from waterfall directly pump for drinking water.

But hiking was little difficult to us bez of worst steps. Een some of those are made by sand.for us it has taken nearly 40 minutes to go up. Route is not good enough for children and elderly people. It was slippery and muddy in some point. When u r hicking u can buy tea and other short eats .ticket price is 20LKR for locals.there are no toilet facilities on the way
Very attractive place,relaxing  and great nature ...the surrounding forest is very nice ... hope to visit again

but stop is hard to find, but take the bus from nuwara eliya bus station toward to Hakgala graden and get off a 1km after the hakgala garden, there is small junction you can get a tuk for Rs,500 to the waterfall steps and its about an 30 -45 minute nice smooth hike.

My friends discouraged me from writing a review because they want to keep this place a secret! When we went there were no tourists - only locals. The hike will take about 45-1hr and I am pretty fit so I had no issues but I can see someone else would. It was refreshing and beautiful. I loved it there
A place that always a memorable action to be more self motivated. Nature has gifted this place to enjoy and protect. It’s always a ella
One of the best waterfalls I have ever seen. Mesmerising and breathtakingly beautiful. Worth the little hike.

A little steep in places but overall a easy walk to the falls following a lovely little stream uphill. The walk is great and the little falls along the way to the large waterfall are stunning. Really quiet, not crammed with tourists and 50LKR each which goes towards conservation in the area. There are little stalls to get fruit and tea along the bottom, but no restaurants which is nice as it’s not built up.

The waterfalls roar naturally amidst the forest and surroundings. It is a very popular spot for tourists. Dress warmly and carry an umbrella in case you are blessed with light rain as were during this expedition
Just below of the tea factory you rest at the restaurant, and while waiting, take a swim in the waterful, there´s a pool of still waters waiting for you.

One hour scenic drive from Eliya we reach starting point of another lovely waterfall & then nearly 2 km relax walk to Bomburu Ella. No hard trekking , just walk through the jungle was a unique experience.Less crowded destination so calm & quite. Water fall is amazing very high magical. still there is no viewing platform but you can go closer to the fall.After reaching lower stage of the fall there are steps to main water fall.That is very misty. Charge for locals just LKR 20( Dec 2018) . but don't know charges for tourists. Highly recommended. worth to visit.
Very beautiful misty waterfall in the upcountry of welimada area very veey mysterious waterfall in the sri lanka.that is a hidden waterfall incide the jungle.
Still Lanka has abundance of small and beautiful waterfalls and majority of them are in this area. This is better one where you have grass fields , small trek and great waterfall...
favorite experiences in Nuwara Eliya.view and environment is excellent picnic and  good place to go.The walks Nice experience.
Adventurous. We went with children's. Wear the shoes while walking. There are two mini falls on the way to final water fall. Nice experience. Own transportation is mandatory.
This is a beautiful water fall.The walk is worth.The walk the  view and environment is excellent. If you have couple of hour a good place to go.

The walk to the waterfall requires a bit of a mini hike and climb where you need to negotiate some very narrow pathways. With a 2 year old who was alternatively being carried and walking, it took us around two hours. But the breathtaking views and the cool weather prevents you from feeling any tiredness at all. Once you reach the top, the waterfall is magnificent. You can rest, have a picnic and take a bathe if you wish. On the way back, we chose a different path and came across some beautiful farmlands that were a treat to the eyes. This was definitely one of our favorite experiences in Nuwara Eliya.

If I could wish one thing right now. It's that please make this place as unavailable as it already is. This place is pristine and untouched. Not many drivers will accept to make the detour since it's remote and unknown. I've seen too many beautiful sights that were ruined by tourism and this wasn't one of them. The trail was beautiful and the waterfalls just as nice. You will probably meet people along the way that offer you food and drinks. We had the pleasure to sit with a wonderful lady who made us coconut rotis and served us masala chai. This is truly a magical place.

This was a last minute recommendation by a friend of ours. It was our last day in Nuwara Eliya so we thought why not, let's do it! It was the best decision ever! The driver told us that this location is not approved by the tourism authorities or something like that so it took us some time and extra cash to convince him to take us. The climb itself to reach the waterfall is amazing and fun. I wouldn't call it a HIKE but maybe a mini hike for those who don't regularly do this. Some might find it tricky to get there but you'll reach the waterfall eventually. I uploaded 3 photos just to give you a hint of what to expect. I wouldn't recommend going there on a rainy day. Oh, and the water stream has leeches which freaked us out when we stepped inside and they started to stick and suck the blood from our feet BUT apparently they're harmless. (i did scream a bit though).

We are get a wonderful experience last weak went to this waterfall. This waterfall situated Welimada to Haggala new road. Not far from Haggala garden. We went to this place through the jungle. its amazing.
